name: Hot Pie's Kidney Pie
instructions: Cook the pie mixture a day ahead:
Preheat the oven to 340F. Place the frying pan on a medium heat, add 1 tbsp olive oil, carrots and onions. Fry until the onions are soft and slightly golden.
Scatter some flour into the pan. Throw in the beef and shake until lightly covered. Return the frying pan to a medium high heat and fry the beef until golden-brown.
Add the beef stock to the frying pan and bring to boil. Transfer to a baking pan and cook in the oven for 75 minutes until the meat is tender and the sauce is thick.

Heat the remaining oil in the frying pan over a medium-high heat. Throw in the kidney and fry until lightly colored then add and cook the mushrooms until they start to wilt. Add the kidney and mushrooms to the baking pan and cook for another 60-75 minutes.
Cool thoroughly, put in the fridge overnight. On the next day, skim off and discard the solidified fat.
Making the Pastry:
Mix together gluten-free flour with salt and sugar.
Blend in coconut oil with and mix until crumbly.
Mix in 1 egg until well incorporated. Mixture may still appear crumbly.
Add milk by stirring small amount at a time until the dough holds appear a little moist.
Cut mixture in half and roll into 2 balls; one for crust, one for topping.
With floured hands, shape dough balls into a disc and place onto floured surface.
Roll out the dough for the crust to slightly larger than the pie tin.
Slip hand gently under the bottom to flip into pie tin. carefully peeling back the paper as you press it into the pan.
Don’t worry if it breaks apart a little, you can always press it together and it will look great!
Crimp edges of crust to make a decorative edge or top with an additional crust layer after adding your pie filling.
Pierce bottom slightly with fork (and slit top layer with knife to vent).
This crust can be prepared in advance and stored in the fridge or freezer (empty or filled) until you are ready to bake.
Pre-Bake for approx. 15 minutes at 425 degrees if you need a pre-baked pie crust for your recipe. Or, you may par-bake the crust for 5-7 minutes to firm up the crust prior to adding your filling
Fill with pie mixture and preheat the oven to 400F
Brush the pastry rim with a little egg, drape the pastry lid over it, pinching the edges to seal. Make a steam hole above the pie raiser, in the middle of the pastry, using a knife.
bake for 30-35 minutes until the pastry is golden brown. Remove the pie from the oven and leave it to rest for around 10 minutes before cutting into it.
author: Dorris Targaryen

name: Barbecued Buzzard Wings
instructions: Boil chicken wings in water for about 7 minutes. Drain and let dry.
Cook all the other ingredients in a saucepan over low heat until the molasses dissolves.
Pour barbecue sauce into a bowl. Throw chicken wings into the bowl tcoat the wings with the sauce.
Place chicken in the baking pan and bake at 350F for 35 minutes.
author: Shado-Pan

name: Curiously Tasty Omelet
ingredients: 3 slices of ham, salami, prosciutto ot whatever you have)
instructions: Whisk together the eggs and water in a small bowl.
Heat avocado oil in a nonstick saute pan over low to medium heat.
Pour in the egg mixture and cook for 30 seconds.
Spread the meat slices on one half of the egg mixture.
Top with the cheese, tomatoes, and basil slices. Season with salt and pepper.
Cook for about 2 minutes or until the empty half of the egg mixture is firm enough to fold over the ingredients. Use a spatula to gently fold the omelette in half.
Cover the pan and cook on low heat for another minute or two or until the omelette is cooked through and there is no raw egg left in the middle.
To remove, tilt the pan and slide the omelette gently out onto plate.
author: Jenna Proudmoore

name: Golden Dragon Noodles
ingredients: 1 shoot of green onion, finely chopped
instructions: Mix together the cooking wine, soy sauce, and miso paste.
Bring water to a boil, add the garlic, noodles and sesame oil.
When the soup boils again, crack an egg into the pot.
when the egg looks like it is roughly cooked (not fully cooked, but appear soft and tender), add the seaweed and green onions.
Turn off the heat and Cover for 1 to 2 minutes.
author: Ella Ironpaw

name: Butterbeer
ingredients: 1 quart reduced fat vanilla ice cream
32 oz zero calorie/diet soda root beer
instructions: Chill glasses in fridge for at least half an hour.
Mix ice cream and root bear in a blender.
Pour into chilled glasses.
Optional: top with whipped cream.
author: Sevon Snape
